result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua E Norman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing 11-15-2016 or serve 7 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joshua E Norman

defendant.name: Norman, Joshua E

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joshua E Norman in court, in custody, by video,  with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   Brian Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    The State moves to amend to a forfeiture of disorderly conduct.  The Court amends the charge, enter a no contest plea and finds the defendant guilty.  The Defendant is sentenced as follows:
FINE: $330.50 to be paid at $50 per month on 11/15/16 or serve 7 days jail consecutive as penalty for non payment.

Defendant Joshua E Norman in court, in custody, with attorney Amber K. Rumpf.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant appears by video.  Attorney Rumpf has received discovery and an offer but requests additional time.  The Court sets the matter accordingly. The Defendant is to appear by video for the next hearing.  Attorney Rumpf to advise the Court how the case will proceed at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 11/16/15.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 11/30/15.

Defendant Joshua E Norman in court, in custody, with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant appears by video.  The Defendant advises the Court that there is a revocation hearing set for 1/21/16.  Attorney Masnica requests the Court set this case after that hearing. The Defendant to appear by video at next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 5, 2016 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua E Norman
Current: 1015 N 10th Street, c/o Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility, Milwaukee, WI 53205 United States  (Effective: 11-30-2015)
Prior: 7708 W National Ave #16, West Allis, WI 53214

Attorney Nicole M Masnica in court.   Defendant Joshua E Norman did not appear.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant has been transferred to Milwaukee Secure Detention Facility and requests the Court set the matter for a hearing and the Defendant to appear by video.   Attorney Masnica to advise the Court how the case will proceed.  Hearing scheduled for December 16, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Attorney Sam Benedict for Nicole M Masnica in court.   Defendant Joshua E Norman did not appear.   David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Benedict advises the Court he believes the Defendant is in custody in Milwaukee County The Court issues but STAYS a capias.  There is an offer and discover was sent in October.  Attorney Masnica to advise the Court if video needs to be arranged for the hearing.  Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Attorney Nicole Masnica appointed for defendant 10/23/15.
Defendant to have no contact with the witness- N.F. dob 8/9/90 or the Walmart store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Joshua E Norman in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.
  Hearing scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 10:30 am.
